uk.ac.nottingham.psyja2.ATCSimulator

Class Aircraft

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.nottingham.psyja2.ATCSimulator.Aircraft

  • public class Aircraft
extends java.lang.Object
    The Aircraft class represents a single aircraft within the simulation. It provies getter methods for accessing properties of the aircraft
    Author:
    Josh Argent

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Aircraft(java.lang.String callsign, Coordinate start, double heading, double speed, double altitude, AircraftProfile profile) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearInstructions()
      Remove all instruction, the aircraft will continue on it's current trajectory
      double getAltitude()
      Returns the altitude of the aircraft in feet
      java.lang.String getCallsign()
      Returns the aircraft's callsign
      java.lang.String getFlightLevel()
      Returns the flight level of aircraft in string format (eg.
      double getGroundSpeed()
      Returns the ground speed of the aircraft (rate at which it moves along the ground)
      double getHeading()
      Returns the current heading of the aircraft (the direction the aircraft is facing) [0 to 360]
      Coordinate getLocation()
      Returns the latitude and longitude coordinates of the aircraft
      double getSpeed()
      Returns the indicated airspeed of the aircraft
      double getTrack()
      Returns the current track of the aircraft (the direction of the path it is moving) [0 to 360]
      double getTrueAirSpeed()
      Returns the true airspeed of the aircraft (indicated airspeed corrected for altitude)
